description:
I liked this place. I got the crunchy taco- it was a normal hard taco shell wrapped in a soft taco. That wasn't the star of the show, it was mainly the meat was super tasty. I got the carne asada. 

Pinto beans and rice were bland.
author: Tina L.

description:
I feel bad for everyone who pays for stale chips, the people working the front end have no time to even go over what they are selling. This is a constant issue regarding their chips which require little to no effort other than placing them in a paper bag. The funny part is that they even put a staple to seal the paper bag and 99% of the time when you already left and crack the bag open you'll find old stale chips that you paid for. 

If a simple item such as chips are left unattended with out anyone knowing their expiration date nor how they taste, I am now wondering how they assure any general food quality?

In a burrito you will find that there is more rice than beans and more then 3x less meat than beans...which means that they are selling you a beans and rice burrito for the price of a protein one. 

This is not about the kitchen crew who very much work their magic to prepare what you need. I think this is more on the Manager or whoever is the acting Manager for not knowing if the food is fresh or old.
author: Davis E.

description: I started to eat here 8 years ago before I moved to San Francisco. They used to put out hot sauces and the place was great with delicious food. Last time I tried it when I was going to Trader Joes I couldn't believe how bad the food has actually deteriorated. I thought I would try it one more time today and I'm standing there at 11:15 waiting for food and they keep ignoring me and I finally asked what time do you open? The dude says usually 11 but he's not ready yet and he points to the guy prepping the food while he's standing there doing absolutely nothing. Next I see the food prep guy bringing out the garbage cans instead of the guy who was just standing there doing nothing. I finally ordered a burrito and ended up having to throw it out it since it was that bad. It had absolutely no flavor at all, so disgusting. It's really sad how cheap they've gotten with their food and the fact they don't even put out hot sauce and you have to practically beg for it has made this place very lame. If you want good tacos and burritos go to Fistful of Tacos on Harrison as they blow this place away and their hot sauces are amazing!
author: VeeMaria L.

description:
This taco is enormous and filled with everything I love. 

My friends and I had to volunteer nearby and would come here to eat for lunch. The Charlie's Crispy Taco is the best. Their taco never disappointed. It was so crunchy and I love guacamole. It just really hit the spot. 

I would definitely say to just try this place if you're in the area and get one of their tacos. You will not be sorry.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by how delicious my chicken burrito was from this little parking lot taqueria. The tortilla was warm with just a hint of grilled goodness, the ingredients were fresh and the hot salsa was plentiful (by request). They even threw in cheese at no additional charge.

Do yourself a favor and get one of these sabroso silver bullets before you grocery shop at nearby Trader Joe's.
author: Carole B.

description: I picked up what the ticket says is an avocado burrito. $7.25 for an under heated tortilla with rice, beans, cheese, avocado, and lettuce with some chemical stay fresh stuff. YUCK
author: Jan F.

description:
Tasty burrito.
Base price is 6.99,  and , another $2.75 for avo, cream cheese. Choice of beans snd meat.

Tip: its enough for two light eaters.

With a medium coke, your meal is $12.75
author: Bert K.

description: Bad service , staff not friendly at all found a white hair on my food and they try to pass it on as mine, but yet I have brown hair .... first and last time
author: Jack M.

description:
Just stopped by here with the Gf. We just wanted something close by and stumbled upon it. 
Good food for relatively cheap prices.

I had the carne asada torta, she had the vegetarian torta. 

Mine was excellent and she loved hers.
I also had a pollo asado street taco which was great. 
Their hot salsa is spicy and is one of the better salsas I've ever had. 

I'd definitely eat here again.
author: Brett D.

description:
In an area that is otherwise devoid of food, Publico Urban Taqueria stands out as my personal lunch oasis.

Recommendation: get the Bowl!!  huge quantity, good balance of items, great hot sauce.

Meats: all 3 are solid options and are not dry or bland (first time I've had really good carne asada in SF).

Price: super affordable given the quantity

Staff: always friendly and funny.  I really enjoy the interactions I have with the guys working here.


This is the closest I have found to the type of Mexican food I loved back in San Diego.
author: Cody C.

description: A suprisingly decent little taco stand outside a mall at about 9th and Bryant. I don't eat at these places with high hopes of really good food but I def enjoyed the tacos from here. Where I live in Tulsa most of your street type tacos have the carne asada overcooked and chopped into very small pieces. Here the meat is marinated and in decent sized chunks, very tender. Saw another customer get one of their tortas and it looked pretty bomb. If you are at the only Bed, Bath, and Beyond in the city proper stop in and grab a few tacos. A little pricey for street tacos but the quality cooking makes it worth it.
author: James R.

description: I wish I can give this place a -ZERO Terrible Customer Service.. There was a hair in my food and the I don't know what he is (Manager NO IDEA) but went ahead and QUESTIONED MEE if I was sure it wasn't my hair or my sisters ??? WTF (My hair is Super Red n my "Sisters" Pitch Black ... That man did not even apologized and asked the other man there to take a picture of the Damn hair THEY somehow put in my damn food... Never APOLOGIZED .... They really need to go take some classes
author: Valeria M.

description:
Better learn balance!

OK, Trader Joe's is right there! You walk in, drop a whole lotta money for healthy stuff and as you are walking to your car, BAM! It's right there! Not that it is not healthy, but come on! A delicious carnitas burrito or a pair of tacos just after you spent half your paycheck on healthy veggie stuff?! I tell you a secret, carnitas, or carne asada or chicken (just in case you don't care for pork) have never tasted so good! So, as you can gather, my love for "healthy eating" only goes so far. Besides, as Mr. Miyagi used to say, "Better learn balance. Balance is key"!
author: Afshin A.

description: The location is convenient and the food is ok.  A good spot if you're looking for both during lunch break.   However, the worst part is the cashier (who I think is the owner).  From going here regularly, I realized he up charges customers without the customer's consent.  Also, I once asked for light ice noticing he fills the cup mostly with ice, then he goes off on a racist rant in Spanish thinking I didn't understand what he was saying.  I would give it a zero star if I could.  If you go here, be careful of what he charges you.  I will never return.
author: Peyton P.

description: Great service but the phone number is not for this location, I ordered thinking it would be at the right location and come to find out that the 9th st one does have a phone at all. Regardless they were able to take my order in person. PLEASE PUT IN A PHONE SO WE CAN MAKE TO GO ORDERS
author: Hileena G.

description: Their food was great and they stayed open a little extra late to serve us some great burritos.
author: Cy H.

description: Nice convenient lunch spot located near Trader Joe's  with a few tables on the outside, parking is easy, basically because it is in the parking lot, food was just ok, l had better, burrito bowl is filling and it is under $10.00 reasonably cheap for the value, if am in this area l will eat here again.
author: Jorge B.

description: This one makes me little bit surprise! Chose the Carne Assad bowl, the bean portion and the beef portion is big enough for a person like me who really need protein, and the meat and bean taste good! The meat does not come with too much oil which is good. So consider the price smaller than $10, this is clearly a good choice!
author: Kelvin Y.

description: Stale chips bad customer service. Rude man not sure if the manager or what but shouldn't be in this type of business
author: Gaby R.

description:
Friendly people and good location, but simply some of the worst tasting Mexican food I've had in my life.  Bland, dry, and unappetizing. All four people in my party looked up from our first bites with horror in our eyes.

The carne asada looked like it had been microwaved, not grilled. The fajita vegetables (which I paid extra for) were soggy and grey. And the salsa was neither spicy nor flavorful.
author: Alex R.

description: I haven't written a yelp review in years. But what I brought back to work literally made me sick. A veggie burrito with hot greasy lettuce. Two bites. I was done. I threw away the burrito and ate half a carton of crackers to quell my stomach and I still had that weird grease in my mouth.
author: J S.

description:
Was running some errand,  and found this little gem in the "strip mall" to feed my lunch hunger. 

Got one of their veggie burritos with some sour cream, cheese and guacamole, and boy was it good. 

Lots of good mexican options here, that are fair priced and tasty. 

If you are running errands in the area, I would definitely stop here for a hunger fix.
author: Sonia A.

description: Disgusting overpriced food. My chicken burrito tasted like dirt. I was starving but threw half of it away.
author: Alex W.

description:
We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon around 2:30/3. I was bummed to find out that they were basically out of all of the meats except chicken and that they were only serving hard tacos because they ran out of soft taco ingredients, which I would have gone for. 

The hard taco was not bad. It was a hard shell that had a small flour tortilla with refried beans surrounding it for backup/support, which I did like. It was filled with lettuce, chicken, cheese, and pico de gallo. Chicken was flavorful but the rest of it was not. The price was right at about 4.25 with tax and it was fairly filling for one taco. 

If you are in that shopping center and starving, then go for it but I wouldn't go out of your way to dine here.
author: Emily P.

description:
Possibly the best Torta in San Francisco. The chipotle aioli spread is delicious. The rolls for Torta are fresh daily so they may run out. 

The super nachos are also really good and a lot of food for the price. The street tacos are a little pricey but super good. 

I work nearby and eat here on nearly a weekly basis. I love this place. It gets busy at lunch time 12 - 12:30 so beware.
author: Adam N.

description:
A bright taco stand conveniently located in an area where you can shop for groceries, clothing and home decor all within 100. Are you overwhelmed with the number of plate and glass options in Pier 1 Imports, but also need to get some new towels at Bed Bath & Beyond for your friends crashing for the night? Have a rest at one of the petite outdoor tables in front of Publico Urban Taqueria and enjoy a small plate of delicious food!  It couldn't have been more than 8 minutes that I waited for my (under $5.00) hard-shell taco. 

Did you see the photo I posted? My taco was huge!! A large, crispy taco stuffed with juicy chicken and pico de gallo, topped with a mound of fresh guacamole. The pico de gallo didn't have a ton of flavor, in fact until I saw the bits of tomato I didn't know it was there. The guacamole was a hit though! I'm not sure if I am a fan of the taco in a taco idea - seems like a waste to me. They put the hardshell inside of a soft-shell flour tortilla, set on a bed of lettuce. Am I supposed to eat the soft-shell with the lettuce? 

The number one benefit of this place is its location.  Two banks with ATM's are near-by. A grocer, 2 home decor shops, a clothing store and best of all.. drum roll please... Free parking! You heard me. 

The staff seemed pretty upbeat and very chill. My order and food were served with a smile. For a quick bite on the go, I definitely wouldn't say no.
author: Jaylena P.

description: Great carne asada street tacos. You can get an authentic Mexican Coca-Cola too, glad I sat down and enjoyed lunch here at this intriguing spot in the Trader Joe's parking garage.
author: Colin O.

description: Forgot to make my quesadilla, didn't realize it until I had been waiting for ten minutes. The two employees then argued about who's job it was to make it. No other customers were there.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Finally! A burrito and bread gave birth to a baby! And it's called a Torta!

I know I know, I'm slow. How could I not have known about this marvelous invention? Don't worry child, I've kicked myself for it already and I'm here to tell you that although this is the first Torta I've ever had, it definitely won't be the last. 

First off, this is a small shop that is in a plaza. It might be easily missed but just look for the line around lunch time. No matter how long it is, get in line and order anything on the menu. 

The  bread came warm and lightly toasted. The beef was cooked medium rare with the amazing pico and avocado combo that blended beautifully with every bite. Unfortunately it does get messy so make sure to grab a lot of napkins! My friend had the burrito bowl and it smelled so good and the portion is so worth it for the price.

I will definitely skip breakfast one day to finish an entire burrito on my next visit!
author: Linda K.

description:
This place is kinda deceiving.  Deceiving in the fact that when you're on a shopping break in between buying discount duds at Nordstrom Rack and buying sad looking fruits at Trader Joes, you think you have this hunger reprieve in middle of your shopping madness.  And yes, it's a shack that literally sits in the middle of a shopping complex.  Maybe it's just me, but I expected some damn good tacos to come out from this roach shack.  

Total utter fail as the tacos are bland and there's no free chips included.  This place is not gourmet but made for the gourmand.  Service is sloppy as the food.  Every time I go shopping in the complex, Publico stands in the middle reminding me and teasing me that good Mexican food is still out of my reach.  Cruel cruel ironies.
author: Bailey N.

description: I've had a good experience here every time I come. Very friendly staff and decently priced meals. I have to say though, despite the amount of sodium in Chipotle burrito bowls, it is more filling there. But I think the quality is a bit more fresh here.
author: Cheri C.

description: Used to make an excellent steak salad for around $7.50. Price went up a couple bucks and the steak is nowhere near as delicious as it once was. Also, no more hot sauce available. Down from a 5-star "hidden gem" to a "not much else around, guess I could do worse" kinda place now.
author: T J.

description:
Nice and convenient location for take out food.
But stay away from chicken and get there before or after lunch hour, gets a bit crowded. BTW the Carne asada Torta and nachos are pretty good.
author: Daniel Z.

description: First gave me the wrong item, then when they tried to correct it they completely fucked it up and again gave me the wrong thing.  Ended up paying $20 for a burrito bowl and threw the whole thing away anyway, couldn't pay me to try to give them my business again.
author: Michael Z.

description:
Surprisingly good because there was no line and it's affordable even for casual Mexican.

Torta here is one of the best sandwiches I've had.  $5.50 enough for a big eater like me.

Crispy tacos are awesome, but not gluten-free because of the outer layer of flour tortilla and possibly the crispy taco has some flour too.  Each one is $4 and enough as a meal for a small eater.

I looked in to see the sanitation and it seemed cleaner than most fast food restaurants.
author: George K.

description: We looked at the menu and pricing and waited in line to order a crispy taco and a tosadita. When we got to the cashier, she told us the prices had changed. The price for the crispy taco jumped from $3.50 to $6.50 and the tosadita jumped from $5.50 to $7.29. We ordered it anyways cuz we had been in line and we were hungry.  The food was decent but we thought this huge price jump at the register was so wrong.  How hard is it to update your menu pricing so you don't surprise your customers after they had been checking out your menu and waiting in line to order?
author: Keith T.

description:
If I know I have errands to run at TJ, Bed Bath and Nordstrom, then I will normally hit this place up to fuel my shopping energy. I usually order some kind of pollo burrito. Today's order was the el magnifico with pollo. It's very filling with grilled chicken, guacamole, sour cream, cheese, salsa rojo, and I chose black beans to stay semi-healthy. It was about $9 after tax.

You can consider it a meal and a half based on the size of El Magnifico. I like the patio seating area, and in front is Peets, where I go for an after meal pick me up coffee.
author: Thomas L.

description: This place does not even deserve one star... My mother bought two tacos from this DISGUSTING place! When she was about to sit down I noticed a hair on one of her tacos! PROOF!? HERE IT IS. Before ordering and checking out the place my mother said she noticed the cooks laughing and staring towards our direction... WE WILL NEVER BE COMING HERE EVER AGAIN! THAT IS FOR SURE!
author: Alejandra F.

description:
Tried the quesadilla not good
Service is fine
Located in the trader joes/bed bath beyond shopping complex
author: Jones T.

description:
Killer little kiosk in the BBB?TJ's center.
My fella chose the crispy chicken tacos. He LOVED them.
I got the veggie quesadilla. For $5, because I got it veggie, it came with guac., black beans, and sour cream for no extra charge. SUCH A GREAT DEAL!!!
When I finally dug in, it wasn't fully melted. I had access to a microwave luckily, and after a couple minutes it was perfect.
Would totally come here again. Will be coming here again soon.
Parking is huge, but I can't go into detail, because I walked over from my fella's work.
author: Kat R.

description:
If there was a 4.5 star rating capability I would do it.
First of all, their tortillas are legit. They are floury and light and almost crispy. Not sweaty and rubbery like most places in SF. They also actually have guacamole. It's extra though. You can't just ask to replace the avocado on whatever your ordering and have them use guac instead . There's an additional fee. The best part though, for me anyway is that they use cheddar cheese. I'm so tired of flavorless Jack melted jack cheese all over my Mexican food. This place is hidden in a strip mall/shopping center but very worth the stop through if your shopping at trader joes or bed bath and beyond.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
We ordered lunch here this afternoon cause it was the only place around besides Trader Joe's salads, which we already bought.....

We got 2 burrito bowls, carnitas and carne asada....both were pretty good.  I ordered the perfecto burrito carne asada, it was not bad at all....

Considering this mall doesn't have any kind of restaurants besides Peet's coffee......

The one thing was no salsa verde, which I love on my burritos, but would return.....
author: Leslie Y.

description:
Conveniently located in an indoor parking lot. I have passed by last week and decided to make a stop for lunch here today. I ordered a Jack Cheese Quesadilla with Chicken and it is delicious. The way the quesadillas are made here looked very interesting. Quesadillas I've ordered at other taquerias are folded up in the shape of a semi-circle resembling a taco. I also found this very interesting and it is definitely culinary creativity. Another spot that will definitely satisfy my Mexican cuisine cravings. I am definitely coming back the next time I am in the area.

I am craving for something else from the menu as I write this review.

When you are here and you're craving for Mexican cuisine, Publico Urban Taqueria is the spot to turn to.

Efficient services and friendly staff members.

FYI: Cash Only
author: Bennett W.

description:
I would pick this place over it's sister location (Dos Pinas) any day.  First thing's first--their prices are way more fair.  I always get the Tossed Mexicali Salad with Carne Asada which is also known as the Sante Fe Salad at Dos Pinas.  The salad here is $2 cheaper than at Dos Pinas--AND the works is included--queso fresca, sour cream, guac, corn, etc.  Also, carne asada is not an upcharge compared to getting pollo asada.  Dos Pinas also no longer includes sour cream in their Santa Fe salad and will charge you extra.

Publico's burritos are also better tasting than Dos Pinas.  Publico's food is basically pretty comparable to any taqueria out there while Dos Pinas is like a Chipotle to me.

And despite almost always being swamped, they're super speedy with just two to three workers on hand.
author: Ivy Z.

description: Delicious food, large portions, fair price.  Eat there or take away.  Cute seating area and the guys working there will heat up your food for you if you're above the "mild" crowd.   Sorry, no habanero's.  Still, we ordered their Nacho's, Chicken Torta and Chicken Burrito.  Customize it.  You're order will happily be made the way you want it.  Clean.  Especially when you consider they're in a parking garage!  This was a fun find in San Francisco.  When we're back in the hood, we're gonna get some more!
author: Reba Jane S.

description:
I'm waiting for a friend of mine at Peet's and I'm starving, so I spot this little shop and decide to take a gamble.

One crispy carne asada taco please.

Sure the shell is the same shell that I can get at Trader Joe's across the street for $3.00 for a pack of 6, but the taco is pretty good considering.

The steak was tasty and not greasy. The guacamole was good. And they gave me a soft tortilla underneath, so in reality I just split up the meat and stuff and made myself two tacos.

-1 star for the cheap and not homemade shell.

About an hour before they closed, they seemed friendly and the service was quite quick.

Which was good enough for me.
author: Jack R.

description: Super good burrito morales with big slices of creamy avocado. Good tacos also. Hit this place up on the way out of TJ's!
author: Lily B.

description: Food is mediocre. Everything seemed fresh, but the rice, steak and black beans are bland. Price is as expexted
author: Brandon M.

description:
I probably should have read reviews thoroughly before stopping in this place. First let me say this. The food was pretty good. The problem was my customer service. 

I got some of the suckiest customer service in awhile here. The young guy( with the slouchy faded t-shirt and jeans) kept saying he couldn't hear me, yet I'm standing right at the window. With an attitude he asked me what type of beans and meat I wanted on my magnifico burrito. After having enough of this fools antics I ask him how long have you been working here? He goes 3 months. *ding * ding *ding (the bell for the right answer) He pauses and asks why I asked? I told him I can tell he's new. The whole time he had an new hire air of arrogance. It's the "I got the hang of this and I'm passed my probation period" attitude. If the owner is reading by chance.....evaluate and stop hiring any silly dope willing to take the job. Also check out Ryan W's review and get rid of that young dude.
author: Sophie P.

description: An amazing place to get lunch!  Line up because they do run out of certain items during the course of the day.  I got two of the crispy tacos which are amazing!  The crispy shell gets stuffed with meat, veggies, salsa, and guacamole, then they take a soft tortilla smeared with beans and put that wrapped on the outside of the crispy tortilla....Delicious!  My gal tried the veggie quesadilla and loved it!  This place is gem and I can't wait to go back for more!
author: Jim P.

description:
NEVER EVER AGAIN. I've eaten here a couple times and have never been impressed so that's already a sign, but last night my husband got the worst food poisoning from this place. He had the salad and knew something was off when he saw the person making the salad place a dirty bowl on top of the lettuce and then move it out of the way to make his salad. ICK. 

I had to wake up to him vomiting violently for the 12th time. It was awful to witness and I felt so bad for him! We both will never be eating here again. 

Publico needs to practice better sanitation.
author: Victoria B.

description:
I eat mostly meat and vegetables and don't need rice, beans, tortillas, chips and everything else other Mexican joints try to shove down your gullet. Like jack in the box I realized Publico has a secret menu when I ordered just a bowl of meat. 

To my surprise I was presented with an enormous amount of freshly grilled chicken topped with pico. Seriously, we are talking about a pound of chicken here. Best part is that it is under $4. I can trot into trader joes next door and spend more on raw chicken that would not taste nearly as good. The quality is high and the taste is excellent. 

If you are paleo, max out Publico before you go shopping. Best quick Mexican for best price I've seen.
author: Anthony G.

description:
Part of the Mission Bay food company, this unique little taqueria is better than decent.  The service lacks in motivation as they make no effort to let you know they're ready to take your order.  granted I'm 6 foot tall, but I couldn't see one person's head through their order window located at about 4 feet high.  After I made an effort to say hello I was greeted with a smirk.  I said "ok" and continued to ask for the salad.  The lady behind the glass window asked "Filler?"  I had NO clue what she was talking about.  taking a stab I asked "Do you mean, what kind of meat would I like?" and followed that with ordering chicken.  No more words were exchanged as I handed her my money and waited for my salad to arrive.

The food was good and with notes about Dos Pinas on the menu I figured as much.  I enjoyed my salad with Chicken "filler", but will not be going back anytime soon.

Pep-up Publico. Gracias por la ensalada.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I've come here a handful of times and had enjoyed the food (I'd gotten tacos, which were good, nothing to write home about, but expensive for a small taco, but I digress).  I came here for lunch the other day and ordered the burrito morales (comes with avocado, lettuce, beans, rice, and jack cheese) with carnitas. I "super-ed it" for an additional $2.75 so I could get more avo (in the form of guac), sour cream, and jack.  When I got back to my office and excitedly began digging in, I noticed a lot of sour cream (which I don't necessarily mind) with a lot of beans and rice, and some carnitas in the mix, and absolutely no avocado or guacamole or lettuce. What a disappointment! I paid $10+ (I left a $1 and some change tip) for a burrito that should have had both avocado and guacamole and no trace of either (what a scam). To add insult to injury, the "gentleman" who prepared my burrito called my number and as I was walking up to retrieve my order, I was met with pseudo-creepy smiles and several winks and incoherent mutterings as I took the burrito from his hands (which he held onto a little longer than necessary).  I smiled back in return, regretfully ignoring his inappropriate conduct.  

I will likely not eat here again and recommend you either do the same or watch them prepare your order so it's made right (to avoid being charged extra for non-existent avocado/guacamole).  I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because previous experiences weren't so terrible.
author: Arlie A.

description: Comfortable seating area. Good service. It's a convenient place to grab food while you're out shopping.
author: Marc K.

description:
Meh, this place is a hit and miss with me.  Sometimes I get what looks like a 2 pound burrito, other times, I get an average size (small) burrito which is fine because it all tastes the same on the inside anyway...meh, consistency? eh all depends on what the guy rolling your burrito is feeling that day.

Urban, eh, more like strip mall which is what it is.  This place can get busy during the lunch hour, you order and pay at the window on the left, they give you a number, the guy in the back rolls it and then expressively yells out your number when your order is ready on the right hand side.  My last visit there I went after the busy lunch rush so it was not busy at the time. I paid and even tipped which I probably shouldn't have done until after I received my food.  Sat down and patiently waited, piddled around on my iphone until my number was shout out.  5...10...15 minutes pass, nobody else was before or after me so, yo where is my burrito mang?  I walk up to the window & just stare like helloooo, I just put in an order 15 minutes ago, paid, and even tipped, hellooo? I ask is number 35 ready?   "wha, numba 35 what is you want? burrito, chicken, black bean?"  He then rolls it on the spot, he could tell I was pissed, he did apologize, but still ...really wtf mang?  

Chips...no, not here, salsa...no, Tapatio in bottles in on the counter, you'll have to go to Trader Joe's if you want chips & salsa to accompany your burrito.
author: B H.

description: Probably the worse burrito in the world. We felt like we were in prison eating prison food, well prison food may even be better then this place. Go to soma street food across the street for some food rather than this garbage establishment. Not to mention, we had a problem with our order and the two guys behind the counter would not help us at all. Garbage!
author: Karley A.

description:
This tiny spot with outdoor seating near TJ's and Nordstrom Rack offers tacos, burritos, tortas, quesadillas, salads, nachos, soup, enchiladas and more. The meat options are limited to safe, popular options: carne asada, chicken chile verde, carnitas verde, pollo asado. Choose from black or pinto beans. They are vegetarian friendly and try to use organic ingredients and local vendors whenever possible.

The street tacos come on two small corn tortillas, soft and pliant, with onion, cilantro and salsa. Tacos are generously loaded with fillings. There is no salsa bar.

* Chicken chile verde taco ($2.29): big tender chunks of marinated local chicken had a nice grilled flavor,  the chile verde was too salty and sour, the red salsa wasn't spicy at all and didn't have much depth of flavor, cilantro was visible but didn't have much flavor, very wet overall
* Carnitas chile verde taco ($2.29): niman ranch pork shoulder was fatty and luscious, but I didn't like the chile verde (too salty, sour) sauce or the red salsa. The taco was way too wet again.

I liked the meats but not the salsas. 

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description: Delicious food (supremo carne asada burrito). My brother got some upset GI and I am currently vomiting my brains out. Don't like to pass judgement as they have a 91, but will never go back. Please be careful.
author: Sam F.

description:
Food baby.  Seriously.

It's weird.  I've been to the Nordstrom Rack here several times before and I've never noticed this taqueria.  Maybe because it's literally a hole in the wall slash food stand.  But today, I was actually looking for a place to eat and lo and behold, the bright red paint caught my eye.

Between my coworker and I, we shared Carmen's Nachos, a crispy chicken taco, a carne asada street taco, and a carnitas street taco.  Along with a Snapple, the total was about $16.

This review will be quick and easy, just like the food.  The carne asada was average, no complaints.  Between the two street tacos, the carnitas stole the show.  Hella juicy with a slap-you-in-the-face kinda flavor.  Both had hella fillings.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mJxt313SBvp9oM1EwpWt1w?select=xzE_dCRPVP1VwLGsvow-wA)  The crispy taco was HUGE.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mJxt313SBvp9oM1EwpWt1w?select=XfwRmPotR87BcvkkMQskUg)  The chicken was moist and had decent flavor.  I'd get it again.  But if I were to only get one, I'd definitely get a carnitas crispy taco.  The nachos were yummers too.  Tons of toppings.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mJxt313SBvp9oM1EwpWt1w?select=kcFs88S4x_ZYos-8-x6q6g)  But I'm a fan of simple nachos, so next time I might just go with their "High School Nachos" which are just chips and cheese.

This spot is perfect for all the hungry Rack or Trader Joe's shoppers.  They have a few tables to eat at right in front.  Napkins, utensils, and everything else is to the side.  Enjoy!
author: Joe M.

description: Is it as good as (name of your favorite taqueria)? Of course not. But it's a lot better than you'd expect. A lot better.
author: Robby K.

description: This location is definitely 100 times better then Dos Pina taqueria.. I've eaten here several times in the past and present. I always order the regular burrito with carne asada and it has been very consistent with good flavors.. After a good workout this regular burrito with no cheese or chips sounds pure good to anyone..
author: Pedro D.

description:
Come here often for lunch. Cheap, fairly good and usually quick. 

They seem to have changed owners recently and now take cards. The downside is that they get overwhelmed and super slow during lunch. They used to be way faster.
author: Zack C.

description:
Found this place by accident and I'm glad I did.  It's located in a stand in the parking garage by Bed Bath & Beyond and Trader Joes; don't let the location fool you, the food hear is fresh, tasty, and well portioned for the price.  

The crispy tacos I had were delicious and larger than your average taco for $4.00.  The taco shell is wrapped with a soft tortilla spread with a layer of refried beans, all making for a nice contrast in texture.  The fillings of the cheese, guac, salsa, and lettuce were all fresh and well balanced.  The carne asada and chicken were well seasoned, well cooked, and also very fresh.  

The guys working  were nice and helpful as I had questions, it being my first time there.  

I will totally be back the next time I am running errands in the area.
author: Ovidio C.

description:
This definitely isn't where you'd go for authentic mexican food.  It's kind of in between Chipotle and what you'd find in the mission. 

Not everything is good, for example, the tortas and the soup suck ass, but the burritos and tacos are clean with reasonably not suspicious meats.

But most of all they have an awesome salad with avocado, black beans, and corn.
author: Skye W.

description:
This review is based upon only on price. Just can't stand when a taco stand charges for every last item including papers, chips, etc. 

This will be my last time at this joint. Plan an extra dollar for items like chips, extra pico de gallo, hot sauce and the like.
author: Bret B.

description:
I really liked this place. I was in a rush an needed a quick bite to eat. I saw this little taqueria and was pleasantly surprised. I loooooove Mexican food and was happy to find that Publico did it justice. I got the Tostadita with carnitas. It was fresh and tasty. My food came out fast too! 

I wasn't put off that they only accept cash. This place is sort of like a food truck so you can't blame them. Plus there is a Chase ATM right next to the ordering window. Also the prices are super reasonable!

The only thing that sucks is that I literally ate my food in a parking lot because that is where they are located.
author: Katarina G.

description:
Very good. Carne Asada quesadilla. Chicken burrito.  Chips.  It's simple and easy for a quick meal while you're on the go. Location is right in the parking lot, so not the best place, but you make do. 

Wouldn't be opposed to coming here again.  It was good. Portions were decent.
author: Denise M.

description:
I was really hungry and couldn't wait so I stopped by this little shop located right outside of Trader Joe's on 9th street. I had seen it so many times while going to buy groceries, but finally tried it (after I yelped to make sure it was decent first of course :D).

Bottom line: Decent place for some Mexican food to get you full that isn't too expensive. Better than Chipotle, but not as good as sit down Mexican restaurants or Mexican places in the Mission (but what is?).

I got the El Perfecto Carnitas Burrito for around $7.50 and it's definitely a sizable burrito that was hand crafted instantly and delivered into my arms within 1 minute! Blazing fast service, just how I like it. It was pretty much a super burrito with rice, beans, guac, sour cream, some other stuff probably, and meat. There was actually quite a bit of meat, like I could actually taste the carnitas and there were some big chunks of it in there. Second to the meat there was a lot of rice. I felt pretty guilty eating the rice and tortilla carbs. Gg.

The girl in front of me got the nachos, and boy let me tell you, she had me wishing I had gotten those instead. At a price of $4.75, I almost turned around and went to order myself one, but being so mentally strong (minus the fact that I came here in the first place since I was hungry), I forced myself to keep walking and settle with just the burrito. The nachos had a lot of stuff on them, that's all I know.

So yea, I think I'll try the nachos next time I'm here. Overall, I am quite satisfied with the pricing, quality, quantity, and service of the food here.
author: Eric S.

description:
My favorit thing here is the Mexicali Salad: 
Two crispy tortillas stacked with black bleans, choped romaine, grilled chicken, corn, radish slices to add crunch, heaping portionsn of avocado and sprinkled with queso fresco. 
It is the perfect combination of yummy goodness..all for $6.50...a steal!
author: Mimi T.

description: A little suggestive sign in front says: Never shop on an empty stomach. I took the advice and got their crispy taco with 100% avocado guacamole. This treat brought me back to life after hours of brain-drain garment decisions. Their crispy taco is the best, and the ingredients are fresh. I go every every time I need a boost from exhaustive shopping at Nordstrom Rack.
author: Brian J.

description:
I was thrilled to stumble upon this place, as there aren't too many places to grab a fast, tasty, affordable lunch in the area. 

I've been here twice now. The first time I ordered chicken tortilla soup and a street taco. The soup was DELICIOUS. It was fresh, hearty, and the perfect amount of spicy. The taco on the other hand, I was not impressed with. The chicken in it wasn't amazing, and their pico de gallo looked and tasted like tomato sauce, which was not appealing in the least. Maybe I got the bottom of the barrel that day, so perhaps I'll try it again another time.

However, the second time I went, I was in the mood for a quesadilla. I ordered one with bell pepper and onion. What I got, however, was a tortilla filled with black beans, salsa, rice, guac, peppers, onions, and cheese. I was a little confused, I thought I accidentally picked up someone else's order by mistake. But the guy explained that that's what they put in their quesadillas. And I mean, it was AMAZING, but I'm still confused - if that's a quesadilla, what do they consider burritos? 

Anyway, I highly recommend the quesadilla and tortilla soup. Good prices. Didn't take too long. Nice people work there. Safe (ish) area. I plan to return!
author: Ashley C.

description: I've been going to this place quite a while. As many reviewers say, it a little kiosk between Trader Joe's and Peet's Coffee. The two items that I always order are the Tossed Mexicali Salad and Burrito Bowl with steak. You may order however way you like. I like both items with no beans, corn, and chips. The food is great and price reasonably. If you want to avoid the long line, come before 12 PM as the line will quite get long.
author: Larry W.

description: Really really impressed with this place! It's always packed during lunch, but the wait isn't too bad. The most popular item on the menu is the mexicali salad. It's LOADED. Fresh avocado, cheese, sour cream, lettuce, beans, chips, salsa. It's freakin' delicious. I like to get the carnitas mexicali salad :)
author: Joanna S.

description:
I'm usually kind of picky when it comes to Mexican food. Most places I've visited have put a big emphasis on specific menu items or are known for their "special" sauce. Then there are places like this that are very humble for what they offer and talk a good talk when it comes to their food.

I had the El Perfecto Burrito with rice, beans, and carne asada. Great flavors all around, like the world's best symphony orchestras playing sweet music to my taste buds. Although the tortilla was a bit saugy, it was made up in everything else. The chips were okay but the salsa made them better. If I were to go back, I'd like to try their tacos. A friend of mine also found them to be a good source for soup. 

Don't expect to find a hole-in-the wall, sit-down. Rather, they have a small...stand?... located outside Trader Joe's and Pier 1 imports. Don't be fooled though, it is legit. There is also limited seating. But I'd suggest to take it to go, unless you want to be BFFs with the pigeons. 

Public Urban is a good go-to. I'll surely come back here when I can.
author: Will S.

description:
literally the only place to eat in the nordstrom mall on a sunday. 

okay food, average prices, quick services
author: Long C.

description:
Beware. Cash only
How can grilled pepper and onions turn out tasteless?
Mushy rice?
How fresh is this stuff? 
That is what I get for going to a taqueria in a shopping center/
author: Stari N.

description: Great place to grab a quick bite to eat. The taco was so huge that I'm glad I took the time to sit down and really enjoy it!!!
author: Natalie S.

description: I come here because it's close to work. It's under new ownership and it's average but usually pretty quick. However the burrito roller had the nerve to look at me today when I added beans to a quesadilla when it was 'busy' (two people in line) and say "thanks a lot for the special order." I work in the service industry and that shit is unacceptable, they lost my everyday business after that move. Terrible customer service.
author: Ryan W.

description: This spot is hella WACK and LACKS everything!! My partner was placing an order to go and all them perverted men that are cramped up in that small space said some things to make her feel very uncomfortable. I will NOT come to this spot for some quick food ever again and ima make sure all my people in the city know about how much this spot SUCKS!!
author: Phil D.

description:
The Mexican torta for its price was a little sparse, but had tremendous flavor.

Carne asada was tender and went well with the avocado and black beans.

The bread it was served on was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, which made the texture of three sandwich a pleasure to experience, especially with the crisp lettuce.

The cilantro mayo was light, creamy, and added a nice set of flavors without being overpowering.

This meal loses a star for its price point, and the lack of decent customer service. They weren't rude, but their apathy shows through.
author: Adrian O.

description: This place is actually good. I ordered a chicken bowl & it reminded me of Chipotle, but better. I wouldn't really recommend the Agua frescas because they're too plain. Tasty, well portioned food for the price you pay. The staff here aren't really friendly, they seem a bit lazy to me.
author: Sara L.

description:
So I'm evaluating on two sets of criteria.   Food and service.

First the food: the Magnifico burrito was an ok burrito. Not exactly a Papalote or El Farolito burrito. Carne asada was sort of blah but ok, the  rice was on the tomato-y side, otherwise the fillings were pretty good and I'd give the burrito four out of five stars. Fairly large portion, but no chips or salsa included for the 8 dollar and something we paid for each one. Keep in mind with price comoarisons that the price one pays for a burrito at a restaurant usually includes things like salsa, chips, a sheltered table, restrooms, decorations or lighting

Note: My boyfriend didnt feel so good after his burrito, its difficult to tell if it was directly causal or not. We're taking a neutral stance on that.

So why are my marks for this place so low? The service!
Like other reviewers, i didn't appreciate the the  new young slouchy caucasian guy at the window. He was the kind of arrogant kid that thinks he's too good for the job, but clearly isn't. So, somewhat disenchanted,  boyfriend and I took our burritos to the table closest to the window, as it was the only one available. About two fifths through my burrito, a couple of pigeons perched in the pipes just above the table crapped on my head, face, both arms, and IN my burrito. So catastrophic, it splattered on everything. My boyfriend watched my bags while I ran to Trader Joes bathroom to wash my everything off.  When I returned with my hair wet, my boyfriend went to the order window to ask about what could be done. I stayed at the table. He told the guy what happened and he unsympathetically replied, "Well, buy another burrito." My boyfriend is a hero and totally bought another, but the guy was a jerk about it and the last thing I wanted after losing half a burrito to a pigeon was to buy another from this jerk. Why should they make an extra sale at our expense off a problem they know about and don't fix? (They had that anti-pigeon netting above the counter area, but nothing to prevent pigeons from perching right above customers.) I insisted my boyfriend cancel the second order and we walked. Honestly, I was getting full and would have taken the rest for a snack like i usually do and I'd have been satisfied with half burrito or a small order of chips or something,  a drink, or even nothing, just an apology would have been nice. Its just not nice to pay for something and by no fault of your own, more the fault of the vendor, not get to enjoy it all.

That sign in their window says "don't shop hungry", but as long as that kid is working there, I'd rather starve than spend another penny here. Next time, I will just buy something inside Trader Joes's and buy myself a real burrito in a restaurant that has restaurant ambiance, amenities and service!
author: Lauren K.

description: This place was serviceable. I liked the nice colors the menu had and the selection seemed OK. I was starving after shopping so I got a Carne asada burrito super with black beans and guacamole. I also ordered a drink. The girl that worked there was pretty cute, though when my order was ready she forgot to give me my drink. I was surprised to see there were no chips included. When it was ready, the chef basically said "here you go gringo." I laughed, but he should be careful about saying that because someone else might take offense. I didn't. I give the lower rating because of these things that fell below standards and bang for your buck. I forget the price but it was probably as much as papalote.
author: Marty J.

description:
After visiting this taqueria located about a block away from my workplace three times and ordering a burrito each time I was ready to write a nice overstuffed 3 star review for them.  Then I decided maybe I should give the place a fourth try and order something I'd never had before.  That was Wednesday afternoon, and here I am writing a 4 star review for Publico Urban Taqueria.

I think they refer to themselves as the "Taco Truck with Zero Emissions".  Clever.  It's literally a hole in the wall with a very limited menu.  Actually, considering the mini size of the place I'm surprised they offer as much as they do.  The little restaurant is located beside the parking lot inside the shopping complex at 555 Ninth Street kind of between the Peet's Coffee and Trader Joe's.

Each time I ordered a burrito here I found the filling to be generously stuffed.  The filling barely fits inside the tortilla so if you like messy, drippy overstuffed burritos this place might be to your liking (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mJxt313SBvp9oM1EwpWt1w?select=eMHWhaemosd4AvKzRex5Pw).  Their base burrito contains rice, vegetarian black beans, queso (cheese), mild salsa (hot salsa is available upon request) and your choice between carne asada, pollo asado, chicken chile verde, al pastor or vegetarian.  I've tried the first three but have yet to go with the pork or the veggies.  I probably liked the chicken chile verde the best; however, the green sauce definitely needs more spice.  Fresh avocado, sour cream, guacamole and other ingredients can be added at extra cost.  My norm is adding sour cream (50 cents) and guacamole (1 dollar).  The burritos are wide and stumpy as opposed to the familiar sleek and narrow silver bullets of other taquerias.  I thought the burritos were nice and filling but nothing really special.

I returned for a fourth time.  There were new items posted on the window.  Enchiladas in a mild "rojo" sauce !  I'll have to try those on my fifth visit!  I selected a Mexican Torta this time which I understood to be a Mexican sandwich.  I absolutely loved it a lot more than I did the burritos.  They take an ordinary looking sandwich roll, slit it open, hollow out some of the bread and add mayonnaise, jalapeno slices, fresh salsa, shredded lettuce, fresh avocado and a generous portion of the meat of your choice.  I selected the pollo asado.  Once the sandwich is made it is toasted hot to the point where the mayo has melted and the outer crust of the bread is hot and crispy.  Take a look at this (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mJxt313SBvp9oM1EwpWt1w?select=_Cl2DTJ8flrPju6nqYuGoA)!  The preparation time for this is a bit longer than the time for preparing a burrito, but in my opinion well worth it.  The torta was excellent!

They have refreshing agua frescas here too.  I've tried both the cantaloupe and the watermelon ones, and loved the watermelon one quite a bit.  Their prices are very gentle on the wallet too considering the large portions you are being fed.  It's cash only though so come prepared.  The restaurant uses recyclable and compostable products and utensils, has outdoor seating and posts a fine looking health score of 100.  The two young ladies that work there are very nice too.  This is a welcomed addition to my list of nearby lunch spots.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Wish they had better hours but the food is great. Good price - Soma is lacking Mexican so this place is great to have nearby.

Be careful: they often close 15-30 min early. Highly recommend the super burrito
author: Alex P.

description: Great selection. Great price. Great flavor. Not the most wow taqueria experience you are going to have, but for the price this place is a 8.5/10.
author: Kory-Oren E.

description:
Tasty. These guys have interesting (but HILARIOUSLY messy) crispy tacos. They take a hard taco and fill it normally, then on the outside they wrap it again in a soft tortilla that has black beans on it. When I received it, the guac and the salsa were overflowing from the top and got all over my hands whenever I tried to pick it up.

Prices are decent, $1.85 soft tacos. Crispy taco was $3.95 but it was definitely filling. I would say the most interesting thing here is their vast array of hot sauces. I tried the jalapeno harissa (tasty but needs more kick) and the jamaican style (tastes more like el yucateco than anything but is nice and hot.)

3 stars for the food (not amazing, not bad) and 1 extra for the great hot sauce!
author: Josh K.

description:
Faking it.

Faux food truck theme continues what started near the SoMa Trader Joe's: http://www.yelp.com/biz/publico-urban-taqueria-san-francisco#hrid:fJ0lEWZy9qnaolJwg_ikKQ

Chicken remains delicious. This time inside one of those bolillo rolls I cannot get enough.

Topped with avocado, lettuce and black beans (available despite what the menu says). Cheese and mayo if you want it.

Service is quicker than the T Third line that rolls right on by.

Neither a deal or a ripoff at $6.50. Truck might be fake. Quality is not.
author: Jason B.

description:
I've passed by this place in multiple occasions on the way to the Peet's right next door and decided to try it one day. Most days when I passed by, there's a line and the seats are taken up but it was usually during lunch hour so it's sort of expected but if it's there's that many people there, it must be good, right?

I show up at 11am and was the third in line and looked over the menu. I decided to go with the burrito bowl since I wasn't in the mood to use my hands on a burrito. The guy taking my order was friendly and my food was made pretty quickly. As for the burrito bowl itself, it was a pretty large portion and had the usual fixings of rice, beans, corn, salsa/pico de gallo, guacamole and meat (I got carne asada). Everything about it was good except one thing - the food was luke warm. I don't expect the food to necessarily be piping hot but this was on the brink of being cold almost.

That aside though, it was good, the guacamole was made with real avocado that I could taste. Nicely seasoned rice, a healthy serving of beans, meat and salsa. The lettuce, I could sort of do without but it was fine. The price was a bit hefty though for a burrito bowl (~$11).
author: Richard C.

description: Freshly made and nice ingredients.  The chicken was very fresh and very nice tasting.  I like the location and decor of the stand.  Wasn't incredible but good enough to eat a quick taco or two.  Very basic.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Used to like this place but it's been going downhill! The Mexicali salad has no dressing anymore, the tortilla soup shrunk to half the size. It's bland and lukewarm. What happened El Publico? Gettin too much business because you're the only food place in the strip mall so you think you can cut back now? It's sad really.
author: Nori L.

description:
I tried every single one of the different hot sauces available here.  Not just boring Tapatio sauce, but there was an assortment: Jamaican, Chipotle, Garlic, whatever else!  Loved itttttt.  I always pass by this little hole in the wall (literally!), but this last time I decided I needed to eat before I did my grocery shopping at TJ's. "Never shop on an empty stomach" says the sign on the window.  Ha! I suppose it saved me from buying a bunch of junk.

The Mexi-cali salad is healthier version of an order of nachos.  A little bit of chips with a lot of chicken, avocado, and lettuce.  Definitely not authentic Mexican taqueria food--more on the Rubio's side-- but that's the way I like it!  

Adding this to my list of easily accessible eats...easy parking, fast, cheap, and relatively healthy!
author: Tokki M.

description:
I usually find myself eating at Publico on my way to pickup groceries from Trader Joe's.  I make it a point to eat at Publico's before I go shopping to avoid "put everything in your basket because you're starving" syndrome.  I've probably eaten at this Publico about 50 times and the only thing I've eaten there is a street taco with chicken.  The only thing my street taco has is the tortilla and flavorful chicken mixed in Cilantro.  I love it because its satisfying and light.  

Why four stars?  Well, a few reasons.  

1) The Publico closes early, typically between 6pm and 7pm.  This is a bad time because its around when I go for grocery shopping as well as dinner time.  The worst is getting there and finding that they closed early (this happens from time to time).

2) The window where you order is made for short people.  I'm over 6 feet tall I have to get on my knees just to place an order.  Poorly designed ordering window.

3) Publico is cash only.  What is with the spread of cash only restaurants/bars/food stalls?  Does the 2-3% credit card companies charge eat that much into profits?  This is the 20th century and we're a society of cashless people.  

4) There is only outdoor seating and as you know, SF weather can be unpredictable (it rains here in July for gods sake)!

Nonetheless, I still recommend Publico if you want a fast, cheap, and quick meal.
author: Ash S.

description: Never shop at Trader Joe's on an empty stomach!  Well, it doesn't matter because I end up spending a lot of money there anyway.  Before shopping there today though, we decided to stop for some carne asada street tacos at Publico Urban Taqueria (great location in the center of the shopping plaza!).  Yummm!  It hit the spot as they are flavorfully cooked with white onions and cilantro sprinkled on top, and they are just the right size to make you full but not too *oink* full.  Yum, we ordered more!!  Afterwards, we still spent a lot at Trader Joe's, but at least we weren't grouchy from empty, growling stomachs!  Muchas gracias!
author: Maile N.

description: Love their Charlie's Crispy Taco and their salad with lime dressing.
author: Linda R.

description: Not bad for a walk-up in a spot positioned to serve mediocrity. Got a carne asada burrito with some guacamole and black beans. Pretty decent.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Note: Vegetarian Review: 

I hate to say that I love this place. Its inconspicuously good. Bean & Cheese burrito (my go to) here is pretty delicious; and for only $2.50, F YEAH!!! Their Veggie tacos have avocado slices, and they for sure hook it up.

Though this is more of a 3 1/2 star kind of place, I'm upping it since, they're super fast, and they're cheap! Faster than waiting in line for a taco truck, no joke.
author: Amber G.

description:
Ever go to the grocery store with the intention of just buying a few things so you just grab a basket.. and then realize that your basket is overflowing and things are falling out, and your arm is really sore from carrying it?  You then a) ditch the basket for a shopping cart, b) sort through the items to see if you can arrange them differently so you can stack them more efficiently, or c) start putting things that you want but don't NEED back.

This is how I viewed my experience at Publico.

After passing by many times going to Trader Joe's, I finally decided that I needed a healthy dose of Mexican food.  I stopped by and ordered a carne asada street taco ($1.55!), a chicken crispy taco, and an order of nachos.

The grocery basket analogy applies to Publico's tacos.  When I opened the box for the carne asada taco, I saw that mounds of carne asada, cilantro and onions were crushing two tortillas, which were sitting sadly at the bottom of the pile.  I tried to pick the taco up, but there was no way I could even get the ends of the tortillas to remotely meet.  So, I congratulated myself for grabbing a fork while I was waiting for my food, and ate about half of the meaty filling until I could pick up the tortillas and eat it like a taco.  Even then, I still had tons of the tender, flavorful carne asada left inside, and it kept squishing out from the ends as I took each bite.

The crispy taco was less impressive.  The pollo was well-seasoned, there were huge dollops of fresh guacamole and pico de gallo, and like its already-consumed street taco friend, the fillings were overflowing.  Outside the crunchy shell, they'd glued on a flour tortilla with some refried bean paste, and I wasn't a fan of that.  If it'd just been a crunchy taco shell, Publico would've earned my 5 stars, as well as my love and never-ending affection, right here and now.

The nachos were the least impressive, as it had what tasted like store-bought Taco Bell nacho cheese (don't get me wrong though, I love Taco Bell), too much refried bean paste, guacamole, pico, carrots (?!) and jalapenos.  Not a fan, and I probably won't be ordering this again.

All in all, Publico is a surprisingly good, cheap, fast place in the heart of the Brannan/Bryant/9th St. shopping center.  Cash only.  CCG stamp of approval *here*.
author: Tori S.

description:
KAGA MARIKO is a Japanese female movie star that sounds like ....

Caga,maricón.

Btw,

me, " can I get 3 bbq pollo and 2 carni asada taco?"

a latino lookin' girl at the store replied, "what?"

me, " I wan't 3 bbq pollo and 2 carni asada taco?"

the latino lookin' girl at the store replied again, "what?"

my GF said, "he said he wants 3 POLLO and 2 CARNI ASADA TACO!"

the latino lookin' girl at the store, "Oh, 3 chicken and 2 steak taco! OK!"

I was like, " whathafxxx? .."

So, my gf got 1 chicken and 1 steak, I got 2 chicken and 1 steak Street Taco, $1.75 each.
Not too bad!
It's pretty good shit.

Btw,
KAGA MARIKO is a well known Japanese female movie star. 

It isn't Caga,maricón, mozafxxxer!
author: Nobu K.

description:
The rumors were true. Publico Urban Taqueria opened a second branch at UCSF Mission Bay's Plaza on Gene Friend Way a little over a month ago. 

I was a fan of the original one on 9th St. because it was so convenient to have a little Mexican food stand in the middle of a convenient plaza like the TJ's/Nordstrom Rack/BBB triumvirate. I'm a fan of this new PUT because it's also convenient.

Publico specializes in fresh food. It's nothing fancy - your average enchiladas, street tacos, quesadillas, frijoles y filling etc. - but it gets the job done. The service is fast, just like at the old PUT and the prices are low enough that you'll want to keep coming back. Mind, it's not dirt cheap but low enough. 

My favorites? Al pastor and chicken chile verde street tacos. I love how they liberally sprinkle cilantro over the food and give you a fresh lime wedge to squirt tasty citrusy goodness over the juicy taco meat. 

The hours here aren't the best given that they have opened in the midst of a graduate residential area. They close at 7 p.m. which is earlier than you would expect. 

I'll update further with their regular hours (I think they recently decided to open for a few hours on Sundays - good decision) and a picture or two!
author: Christine P.

description:
This is quite possibly one of my favorite Mexican stands in the city. My friend would always bring me the bean and cheese burritos from this place, and I never knew where she got them, but I was hooked. The other day she took me here so I could finally see for myself where I could get these amazing burritos and other Mexican deliciousness. 

I definitely recommend the bean and cheese burritos which are about $3 I believe. Their refried beans are actually made of black beans instead of pinto beans which is AMAZING. I tried the Charlie's Crispy Taco ($4) vegetarian way which came with roasted peppers and onions and guacamole instead of meat, along with a crispy and hard taco shell, pico de gallo, cheese, and lettuce. My my my was it good!

I'll drive out to this place just for the food, but you can kill 2 birds with one stone and go shopping in trader joes or nordstrom rack while you're at it!
author: Ashley D.

description: Decent burrito for its price. My Perfecto Burrito wasn't fully wrapped at the bottom, so my fillings fell on to the table. Thanks!
author: Enrique D.

description:
I literally work across the street from this taqueria. I have always found the food to be fresh and delicious. Some favorites are the street tacos (can't go wrong! so simple, so tasty!) and the salad. All of the meats are good, juicy and good quality.

The wait is never long either but be warned, cash only. 

My one complaint is that chips are extra and frankly when I do splurge on them, the portion is too large and I end up wasting half of them. 

I reccomend this taqueria, no frills, but deeply satisfying food.
author: Rachel E.

description:
No real review on the food as I was not afforded the opportunity to even order.  When I went, two women working both windows were chatting on their cell phones (to each other? who knows).  One kept pointing to the other, and I inquired as to whether they were open or what.  The other one.. tall nasty looking redhead gave me tons of 'tude and said "we're switching registers... OKAY?"

Beyotches.   I will never have the chance to see if they're any good or not, cuz I now hate them.
author: Matthew G.

description:
Besides this complex having some of my fav stores (Trader Joes, Pier1, Nordstrom Rack, etc), this little shack is really really good! 

My husband and I tried the same thing - a crispy taco wrapped in a soft tortilla but he had the chicken version and i the veggie version. IT was super flavorful and so satisfying.

Must try, but check the timings for operation! :)
author: Sapna E.

description:
This place is good if you're shopping at Trader Joe's or Nordy Rack and just want to grab a quick bite.  The salads are tasty and the tacos are good but messy, knife and fork messy.  Definitely not your typical taqueria, but good and fresh.  The chicken verde is what I usually order.  
In my personal opinion, they should change the hot sauce selection.  A place advertised as a taqueria should not only have Louisiana hot sauce to choose from.
author: anne m.

description:
First time here so I ordered 3 street tacos: Carne asada, green chilies chicken, and the other chicken.  All have a kick so diner, beware. 
Good bang for the buck. But you better like spicy or order anything mild.
The simplicity is a delight and the value is completely unbeatable in this city.
author: J S.

description: This hidden gem that is tucked away in a small city shopping center in Soma off Bryant and 9th street (Trader Joes, Bed n Bath, etc). Truly a hole in the wall operation with first class fast food!! Hooray for the Mexican salad, trust me just try it. The street tacos are also fantastic, as they are stuff to the max with your choice of meats. I like the chicken and carnitas best.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
I don't see why there are so many bad reviews? I frequent this place a lot after I shop at trader joes or bed bath n beyond. I've never had a bad experience with the customer service or the quality of the food. Yes it does suck that they take cash only but don't all taco trucks? 

I always get three street tacos. 2 carne asada and 1 pollo asado with extra onions and cilantro and hot sauce. I always like my Mexican food with more of a kick of flavor since I find most tacos to be bland. I love how the carne asada has no fat at all. It's real pieces of steak and no weird fatty stuff. The chicken is also marinated well. The servings are generous in each taco and I get full off of 3. 

I haven't tried their burritos yet since I can't really finish one by myself but I'll have to try one soon. Tacos are $1.85 each and remember it's cash only.
author: Fran N.

description:
How in anyone's world could this place average out 3.5 stars confounds the realms of my imagination.  Really?  We were shopping at Trader Joe's and hubs was whining of painful hunger pangs.  This place is a small booth outside TJ's with a small outdoor seating area next to it.  In a moment of weakness, I agreed to eat here.  I ordered the carne asada enchiladas and he ordered a burrito.  Of the three enchiladas that came on my plate, I couldn't bear to take more than 2 bites of one of them.  Was about to toss it before my husband intercepted out of curiosity.  He thought my enchiladas were better than his burrito (no way in hell I was going to try a bite of his burrito so I can't comment personally on its taste) but it was a consensus that our respective orders tasted gross.

One star is a misrepresentation by the mere fact that it gets a "star" which is generally accepted to connote some degree of worthiness.  Damn, this was bad.   

Cash-only.
author: Liz K.

description:
I like burritos. I like tacos, too. I really like tortas, and I never ever order them because they're never quite as good as I'd like them to be. greasy taqueria tortas are a fine and wonderful thing.

Publico serves up a DEEEEEEE-licious torta. mine was carne asada with all the fixins and I am kinda sad I already decided to save the other half for tomorrow's lunch ... it was that good I'm willing to expand the old belly.

I've also had veg, chicken and carne asada burritos, and they're each quite tasty. the refried blacks sort of create a one-note flavor, but still tasty and CHEAP. I mean, $5.15 for a burrito is hard to find even in the Missh!

oh, and they do a crispy taco that possibly even rivals Nick's [or Underdog's, or whoever does the good ones these days ...]

surprise! clean hole-in-the-wall CaliMexi eats when you're bushed from a Nord's trip or are preparing for TJ's.

I will go back.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Okay so I had the Mexican Torta today (7/12/11) for lunch! I must say it was DEEEELISH!!!!!
The Carne Asada was flavorful and tender, bread soft and grilled. 
Check em out! :)
author: Yolanda M.

description:
Positives: very very very tasty burrito. 

Negatives: burritos are a bit undersized relative to others in the Mission (good if you want a light-ish lunch); nickel and diming is lame (cheese is a dollar extra, guac or sour cream is extra, lettuce is extra); no free chips (really? are we that bottom line?).
author: Konrad P.

description:
The Tortilla Soup is so amazing! I hadn't tried it until yesterday, and today had to go back again! It's got rice and avocado in it along with the soggy tortillas and shredded meat. YUM!!!!

I also really love the Mexicali Salad (minus sour cream, plus chicken).

YUM!

Cash only, so be prepared!
author: Diana Z.

description: It just isn't good food. The food is luke warm at best there's no flavor, beans come from a can, just don't waste your time. They also don't follow directions, I asked cilantro in my burrito and they put it in a cup in the bag, the red sauce is just tomato sauce. Just not worth the money or time.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Street tacos for $1.75 and they're piled high with delicious meat!  What a deal!  I'm definitely going back to try the crispy taco.

The meat was flavorful, we had the al pastor and carne asada tacos. 

The place is clean, the food looked and tasted fresh and it's easy on the wallet.  I only wish they were open later than 7pm.
author: Becca L.

description: Their salad is a great deal. Really fresh. I asked for a side of guacamole and it was the smallest container EVER for .50. Boo!
author: Suzanne B.

description: Disappointing. Ordered a veggie burrito and it was EXTRA oily. On top of that, I gave the cashier $10.07 for a $6.07 bill and was expecting $4 back. He insisted that I gave him a $5 & $1 bill but I am certain I gave him two $5s. I argued back but then let it go because he was not budging. It's especially disappointing because the burrito was so sub-par.
author: Seema M.

description: I spent 5 years in San Diego, and this is the place the reminds me most of the tacos from there. Solid, tastey. Could use more selections, but they are good at what they offer.
author: Raymond H.

description: I get Charlie's crispy chicken taco every time!  Like a chalupa....taco in a burrito wrap with beans for buffer.  It's good, convenient & hella cheap...rarity in this city.  Don't go to Trader's hungry!
author: Ramon L.

description:
Hands down...the best street tacos in the city.

Not to mention they are dirt cheap. With tax, it's about $2.03 or something along the lines of that.

Always stop by here when I go shopping. Two street taco's: perfect portion and delicious.
author: Cristian G.

description: Surprisingly good, fast and just what we needed prior to shopping at TJ's.
author: Dave S.

description: Pretty good tacos. I'm not going to say that this place is good enough that you would actually endure one of the world's worst parking lots just to eat there... nope... no way jose. However, if you find yourself at Nordstrom Rack, Bed Bath & Beyond, or Trader Joe's, and you need a snack, this place will hit the spot. My taco was like the "double decker" tacos that Taco Bell used to (or still does) have.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Despite being non-Hispanic, unable to speak Spanish, and unable to cook for shit, I still for whatever reason feel qualified to label Publico and others like it as "gringo taquerias."  That's not necessarily bad; Papalote is pretty good, and Chipotle is ok.  Here are some telltale signs of a gringo taqueria:

-Modern and/or weird decor
-It's clean
-White people work there
-They have obscure hot sauces instead of Tapatio and the like
-You have to pay for chips
-The chips come in sealed packages (that was a new one for me)

I ordered a veggie burrito, which was ok.  The beans and rice were a little dried out and not too flavorful.  They used fresh sliced avocado instead of guacamole, which I like, but the avocado wasn't ripe enough.  The grilled veggies were a nice touch, and the cheese was good.  I had to pay extra to get sour cream in there, but the total was still under $6.

The location is good and the environmentally friendly practices are commendable.  I put some of the garlic hot sauce on my burrito; it was hot for sure but I would much rather have Tapatio or something like it.  I think they did a good job with the eating area; some simple tables semi-enclosed by plants.  It slightly blocks out the parking garage that you are surrounded by, and there's some natural light from above.

I'm sure I'll try Publico again next time I shop at Trader Joe's during the day (which, I'd forgotten, is an awful experience on a Sunday).  But my impression is that this taqueria is mediocre.
author: Joseph N.

description:
This place has solid street tacos ($1.85 each) and burritos.  I usually get the taco al pastor, which comes piled high on two little corn tortillas.  There's so much meat that I usually split it in half and use the tortillas separately.  Today, I got the burrito al pastor instead and it was delicious! It has rice and beans inside with the yummy meat and makes a fat mess that requires 3 or 4 napkins.  I really like their selection of hot sauces too.  

This place is the perfect stop before heading into Trader Joe's.  It totally makes up for the crappy parking and stupidly long lines inside TJ's on a weekend afternoon.

By the way, it's cash only.  If you're out, there's a Wells Fargo ATM nearby.
author: Nina L.

description: Very BOMB tortilla soup. Spicy and hearty. Made me feel much better being sick and all....
author: Jocelyn J.

description: Cheap, tasty street Mexican food.  Good crispy tacos.  Try the pollo verde topping.
author: Arvindh K.

description: Prices have gone up in the last few months but food is still the same and service has gotten worse.  The last four times I've ordered they have gotten my order wrong - I don't like lettuce in my burritos and I prefer refried over black beans and I'm very explicit about this when I place my order.  Today they got both wrong.  And I had to wait 15 minutes for my order.  Think I will just stick to the items on their menu from now on, and/or go after the lunch rush since there's only one guy making the food...
author: Judy L.

description:
Not bad.

Had the street tacos, grilled chicken.  The chicken had a good flavor and the salsa was very good, not too spicy.  They were very fresh tasting, not oiling like some street tacos from taco trucks.  My friend had the nachos, they looked good- topped with plenty of guacamole, sour cream, beans salsa and jalapenos.  I would go back, the tortilla soup looked interesting.

Cash only,  a few tables right by the stand for outdoor seating only.
author: L M.

description: The Crispy Taco with Chicken was one of the best things I've eaten. Soft taco shell with beans, cheese over a hard taco shell with generous amounts of delicious grilled chicken and avocado at a great price. Solid.
author: Don W.

description: A little gem tucked away in a busy strip mall
author: Matt V.

description:
Had two veggie street tacos for $3.80. What a price! They were really good! Lots of folks there for lunch sitting outside.
However, I made the mistake of not taking the "insane" warning on their insane hot sauce.
I love me some painful food, but this was off the charts. I was in total misery for about 20 minutes. You are warned!
author: Owen T.

description: I ordered a carne asada taco here and bit in to find a huge piece of twisted metal wire in my food. I was obviously freaked out and disgusted. The kid at the counter gave me my money back but, there's not a chance in hell I'd ever eat here again. The one bite I did have was pretty gross and flavorless anyway.
author: Ms. G.

description:
Soooo I'm a funemployed gal on the go who likes tiny snacks to keep me going...oh and beans.  I really like beans.

Enter Stage Left; Publico.

for UNDER $2 i received a hearty veggie taco with beans, grilled peppers, queso AND avocado.  For gods sakes you can't get a SIDE of avo. for under two dollars at some places.  Perfect for on the go, yummy, not greasy 'happy' mexican food...you know what i mean.

Trader Joes run with a Publico Taco - my new errand extraordinare
author: Melissa H.

description: One fine crispy pollo taco.... $3.99 fantastic! .... only draw back is the old empty seating area with agitated SF drivers honking for no reason .... nothing fancy but good fast service and fresh ingredients. The street taco's are good as well.
author: Sam B.

description: This review is based on the price and how the burritos tasted. This place is a ripoff. They charged me $18 for 2 super burritos and didn't give me chips. Every other Taqueria i've ever been to in and out of the United States gives you chips and salsa,guacamole to go with the chips for free. These guys are idiots and i am never going there again. The only reason i didn't make a scene right there was because i was on my lunch break. They have a stupid sign up saying that all prices are final and that there is no bartering,negotiating etc. These idiots wouldn't need that stupid sign if they would just charge what Taqueria's normally charge and give chips. This is the most expensive Taqueria i have been to in San Francisco in the last 11 years. They will get no repeat business from me. I recommend skipping this place and going to Taqueria Cancun on the corner of 6th and Market. The burrito's didn't taste how burrito's normally taste. They are scamming. They aren't running a restaurant, they no overhead cost, when i went there i only saw 2 people, they work in what almost looks like a painted up wooden outdoor shed and they are charging more money and not giving simple things like chips and salsa and guacamole. I've been to several other Taqueria's that are actually restaurants,have to pay overhead cost, have several employee's and still manage to charge a good price, offer a better service, and offer things that chips,guacamole,salsa free of charge. I'm not the kind of guy who would normally feel the need to ask about things like this before placing my order because other places normally do it right. It would be like going to McDonalds and ordering a number 2 and not getting french fries.
author: che p.

description: I'm obsessed with their bean and cheese burrito!!! I usually get the kids portion because it's a decent portion and it's under $4 (cash only). Everything I have seen them make looks awesome and I love their black beans.
author: Jenna Q.

description:
